job_title: Full-time Faculty Member in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Helping student develop in body, mind and spirit.
cons: None for now. Great place to work.

pros: It's by the lake - other benefits are ok - Christmas break is nice.
cons: Very low starting pay, not based off experience. - general minimal raises - not performance based at all. Currently only at $15.50phr.

pros: nicest people to work with
cons: pay is low and promotions are limited

pros: Very friendly and team-driven work environment
cons: Not always the most receptive to change, but getting better

pros: Great place to work for
cons: Low pay. Needs to pay more

pros: Great job for a student!
cons: Great job! Can’t think of many cons!

job_title: Full-time Staff Nurse in Mequon, WI
pros: Students are great, staff is nice
cons: Everyone for themselves, one of my supervisors made it a very toxic environment.

pros:
Great work environment.
Schedule Flexibility.
Convenient for students.

pros: Christian environment, very supportive team.
cons: The pay was very low for the workload.

pros: Fun and relaxing work environment
cons: to me there are no cons

job_title: Graduate Admissions Counselor in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Positive, great environment, great people
cons: Really none to complain about.

job_title: Instructional Design Team Lead in Detroit, MI
pros: The team members and work environment are enjoyable.
cons: There is almost constant change and transition.

pros: Communicative, upfront, kind, supportive, fun.
cons: There are no cons at CUW.

pros:
Flexible with classes

review_title: Low pay additional requests slow to promote
pros: Nice rural location by the lake
cons: Little support, only church members recognized and promoted, chapel daily

pros: I met so many great people through this job and was able to connect with communities within our school.
cons: Underpaid, under appreciated, overworked, poor management

pros: Flexibility, Kindness, Proactive, Progressive, Inclusive
cons: The ever changing school system

review_title: Flexible but promotion opportunities are slim.
pros: Flexible, caring, education benefits, opportunities to move between departments.
cons: Promotion and pay increase opportunities are slim.

pros: I really appreciate the flexibility of my current position.
cons: There are frequent changes within the University.

pros: Supportive environment that showed flexibility.
cons: pay is lower than what would be expected.

pros: Wonderful benefits, beautiful workplace, great staff
cons: Salary is very low compared to private companies in the area.

review_title: Nice co-workers, but administration severely undervalues its employees
pros: Not just a Christian institution in name only.  They actually openly espouse Lutheran values.  A lot of really great co-workers.  In general, a laid back atmosphere.
cons: The IT department is completely and utterly mismanaged.  Nepotism abounds.  As a result, I believe there is a general disdain among administration for IT employees.  This is directly evident in the abysmal salaries.  I defy anyone to find someone with equivalent responsibilities who makes less than the people in CUW's IT department anywhere in this country.  It is absurd.  And no amount of friendly co-workers can compensate for this lack of valuing of the employees.  I am just disappointed I didn't get out sooner.

job_title: Assistant Professor of Business in Mequon, WI
pros: Familial, live the mission, student to staff ratio, flexibility
cons: Compensation not competitive compared to like role at other institutions.

pros: Nice place to work at
cons: Pay is very low at this company

pros: I enjoyed my co-workers.  The adult learning side has seen enrollment success because of a well-constructed program that is consumer friendly.  The facilities are nice and well-kept.  The main campus in Mequon is gorgeous. You get the sense that people have good intentions, but just aren't always super capable.
cons: Pay is low, as others have stated.  The adult learning side is run like a for-profit college; minimal attention paid to academic standards/quality/integrity.  It's all about the money, which can create ethical dilemmas.  Employees at the adult learning centers are treated as second class citizens compared to those on the main campus.  Oversight at the adult learning centers is poor and lacking; I rarely spoke to a supervisor from the main campus.  They try to centralize things like financial aid and records management (surely to save money) and that also creates issues.

pros: The free health care plans are very nice.
cons:
Very cult like, everyone is related to everyone and knows everyone's business. If you are not part of that group you will get no where here. Favoritism and nepotism are huge here. 
Upper management level has no skills or idea how to run the place and doesn't ask the right people for ideas before running with what they think will work.

job_title: Academic Support Services in Mequon, WI
pros: Concordia has a beautiful campus that is accessed completely indoors via walkways and tunnels, so no going outside in the brutal Wisconsin winters.
cons: The atmosphere is insular and cult-like; few people from "outside" CUW do well in this environment. You are either a lifer or looking to jump ship within a year.

review_title: Good Place to Get a Start
pros: Concordia is a great place to work post-graduation as they are willing to hire employees without any experience, however the salary will likely be lower than average.  There are experienced veterans in many of the fields, so it is an excellent place to develop skills during graduate school or even after, and then use those new skills and experience to work elsewhere.
cons: Like I said, an excellent place to begin

pros: Great work environment, less political than many universities.  Administration is generally approachable relative to other universities.  The campus is very modern and located on Lake Michigan.
cons: Located in Wisconsin, cold for 6 months of the year.  Salary is low compared to industry and there is division on campus in terms of salary with the Pharmacy school

review_title: Concordia provides a warm christ-centered work atmosphere and you are surrounded by people who care.
pros: Great cowerkers and administration. Beautiful location. Students are kind and fun to work with. Exciting things happening all the time!
cons: Pay is low. Winters can be brutal.

review_title: Great in theory, poor in practice
pros: Generally kind people. Good work-life balance. Good benefits.
cons: The ways that the Lutheran-ness expresses itself are incredibly inconsistent. Very un-Christian drama and financial decisions. Says they worship Jesus, but in fact worships money.

pros: The environment and location of the school on the bluff of lake Michigan is very peaceful and calm. this makes the drive to work very peaceful, and welcoming
cons: Being a student worker, there is really not much i can say, aside the fact that the pay is very low. wish they could increase it, cause some of us actually do a lot.

review_title: 15 years higher ed administrator and educator
pros: Professional atmosphere and committed colleagues , student centric environment, allow for professional growth at all levels: teaching, service, and research, high moral/ethics for mission and service work to underserved communities.  Pro-veteran
cons: Adhere to Lutheran ideas that may be outdated with younger generation of students

review_title: Opens a lot of doors - if you put the effort into it
pros: A lot of support from peers and other coworkers, provides a lot of great experience for really any field outside of college.
cons: The job is what you make of it, if you're not putting much in you wont' get much out from other staff members or residents.

pros: The working environment is very condusive . The open door approach adopted by the head of  maintenance department is an ice on the cake of the leadership style at Concordia University. There is also an opportunity of working in an environment filled with people from diversed background.
cons: The take home pay is not bogus compared to other sectors.

pros: flexible, good salary, benefits better if tenured or part time/full time employee, local, christian but also non-denominational, university sports, supports all faculty, tuition reduction for full time employees
cons: christian, graduate and doctorate grants/scholarships not available.

pros: I had a good experience here. Most of the professor are nice. Culture is a good thing that I can learn.
cons: Few professors are not nice to international students, and the higher management can not speak to individuals.

job_title: Residence Hall Director in Mequon, WI
pros: People care deeply for students, a lot of loyalty to the institution
cons: No upward mobility, Lutheran students are a large minority, and the culture of the institution is Lutheran leading to many from different backgrounds feeling like outsiders.

review_title: Great Environment to be a part of
pros: Coworkers are wonderful, and the students are even better.
cons: Salaries are low, and you most likely will not get a raise. (Staff only, I am not sure about faculty)

review_title: Caring, devoted people. But LOW pay and cult-like atmosphere.
pros: The people at CUW are caring, friendly, and devoted to their work. It's a good community.
cons: They hire their own graduates, almost exclusively. It leads to a very insular atmosphere that places loyalty above quality and talent. Senior members of administration lack basic knowledge of higher education administration principles.

pros: Flexible Schedule, Good Benefits, Decent Pay, Beautiful Campus
cons: Very old-school way of thinking; not the most up to date technology-wise; Management is an old-boys club

pros: They allow you to excel with good encouragement
cons: Few  hours of working

pros: Very flexible schedule as you work around your school schedule
cons: Paid minimum wage with small increases every year you work

pros: Amazing community and great place to work.
cons: Higher education in general is going through challenging and uncertain times.

job_title: Front Desk Student Worker in Mequon, WI
pros: Easy, meet new people, fun and entertaining
cons: Not a lot of hours

pros:
flexible hours
Learn cultures from around the world
cons:

job_title: Student Contributor, Office of Strategic Communications in Mequon, WI
pros: Great Supervisors and Fun work Environment
cons: Same minimum wage set for all student worker positions

pros: Flexible hours, practical experience, convenient.
cons: Not much access. Limited amount of authority.

job_title: Student Success Coach in Mequon, WI
pros: Supportive coworkers. Pleasant work environment
cons: Low pay, no benefits for part time

pros: Solid management, structure, and environment..
cons: None that I can think of.
